bow: mo sleep what am missing ladies my month old daughter is still up times night and just dont know if this is just how it is or if there is something can do better bedtime is consistent at pm she gets total of 11 hours overnight and about hours during the day usually broken into naps she nurses for naps sometimes to sleep sometimes just drowsy but it is separated from bedtime by about half hour or so we do dinner nurse bath story song sleep she may fuss for minute or but goes down really well and settles herself fairly easily at bedtime and naptimes the problem is that despite the sleep training and good sleep habits ve been working on for months she is still up every to hours or so overnight try to let her settle herself if she wakes up and sometimes she does and sometimes she does usually go in if it takes longer than 20 to 30 mins in the middle of the night depending on whether she is disturbing my son how long it has been since her last wake up and how close to getting up time it is but she is more consistent with not settling than she is with actually settling in the night time feel like doing it right but it just not working is this just my life now any advice or experiences are helpful have you started solid food yet found my guys sleep schedule got wayyy better once we started solid food and could get his belly bit more full before bed each night mine slept through the night at 18 months despite eating plenty of solids and us attempting to fix things we did get her down to one wake night at which point she would come to bed with us sometimes there just nothing you can do about it this too shall pass my kids are grown both got up few times per night until they were then they magically started sleeping through the night and were great sleepers since miss those night time cuddles sometimes co sleeping makes the night time awakening easier just be patient and know that this phase will not last forever and one day you ll miss it mine is still doing this at 17 months old we ve tried everything too starting to think that these people on the internet are dirty liars lol sometimes think there just nothing you can do and your kid is your kid didn sleep through the night as kid and still don as an adult this sounds familiar months was super rough time for us too when it came to sleep in our case it was teeth plus the sleep regression that hits around that time it took few weeks to pass but he did start sleeping through the night again sounds like you have solid routine think the sleep disruptions at that age are pretty common what is she doing when she waking up or what are you doing to get her back down my month old wakes times night and occasionally more but she needs to eat and it just 10 min and she out if she not actually hungry she will fuss and move around but not actually cry so leave her be no matter how long it is at this point the times when she fussed because she is self soothing have gotten shorter compared to few weeks ago sadly some kids just keep doing this be as consistent during the wake ups as you can keep telling yourself you are doing everything right and this is going to pay off eventually because it will it just sadly might take while so sorry momma we ve been there and it just not fun we have yes meals day varying in size depending on her willingness to comply but she does love food thinking of trying formula supplement in the evening but really dont rhink anytging is wrong with my milk and think she is full enough but everything is worth try before throwing in the towel suppose ve had some friends who say when they switched to supplemented with formula their kids started sleeping better we were always formula so not sure do know that bowl of oatmeal and banana before bed did the trick after starting solids my month old still wakes about once night and sometimes not at all if he wakes up fussing help reposition him he come to love sleeping on his side and when he half asleep he can coordinate himself into comfortable position if he wakes up crying he needs to eat theoretically speaking at this age if they receive the correct amount of calories during the day they are physically able to sleep through the night however before solids at most would get four hour stretches and he always woke starving it sounds like you are doing everything right if you feel like something maybe off speak with your doctor your lo may have something going on that is waking them we had to night wean my husband went in for every night wake up for 10 to 14 days and then he started sleeping through the night that was at 14 months second this unfortunately my lo did this until we night weaned at months once she realized it was dad coming in with an ounce or two of bm formula rather than mom with the boob she must have felt it was worth it and immediately started sleeping through the night neither of my kids slept all night until 18 months one was formula fed and one breast fed so don think that was it they just had to developmentally get there we tried sleep training night weaning all that they just did it on their own terms this too shall pass after the first few weeks my baby was only waking up once or twice night until months since then it been times night and the only thing that soothes her is feeding back to sleep tried stopping feeding her to sleep which kind of worked for naps but just meant lots of crying at night now at 11 months ve just accepted that if feed her for 10 minutes she goes straight back to sleep and that means so can and am grateful if she sleeps for hours at time most of the babies we know from groups we go to are similar in that they still wake up few times think they all get there in their own time know that probably not quite what you want to hear and really you want the magic sleep secret but if it exists have found it even after much experimentation just wanted you to know you re not alone and the wake ups sound pretty normal to me it ferber time or well let her wait 30 minutes longer between feedings every day most likely she will fall back asleep within those 30 minutes because this is sibling sabotage not hunger carb load before bed at that age they are growing lots from dinner to bedtime snack snack snack oatmeal right before bed or cottage cheese something that will keep them full but also babies need what babies need that includes night time snuggles one day we will all sleep again good luck oh holy crap could ve written this we sleep trained my currently 15 month old at months and it was until the last month or so that he finally stopped waking multiple times night we could even go in there to comfort him because it just piss him off more when we left so we seriously spent months listening to him cry during the night now he does want to rock or cuddle at bedtime he just wants to be put down so he can flop over and go to sleep she ll get better stick with those good sleep habits and it ll all pay off my little boy had similar issues at that age we got him crib aquarium made by little einstein that plays soft sounds and gives gentle light he would push the button to turn it on and it gradually goes off itself after about 15 minutes that helped him with self soothing also did modified ferber method for soothing him when he woke up to help him learn the self soothing part hope this helps strongly recommend the blog weebeedreaming com what would recommend to start is when she wakes at night wait 15 min before going to her room give her the option to self soothe and go back to bed this may or may not work if you are at your wits end would hire the sleep consultant from the blog posted it really inexpensive in comparison to the need for sleep think when did it it was 200 us for two weeks of sleep assistance she is in canada so it was all over email for me super detailed questionnaire and daily emails and personalized sleep schedule routine we did it at months since absolutely could not continue nursing 6x night good luck be interested to see if these food suggestions work or not could she be uncomfortable temperature is her diaper very wet needs lovey or something for comfort is she hearing some kind of noise like cars or animals outside it not abnormal to wake up during the night most of us wake up during the night the sleep training is not about making them sleep all night it about them falling asleep on their own so when she wakes up if she is getting herself back to sleep most of the time then there is probably nothing that needs to be done sounds like what ve been trying byt perhaps time little longer this is what afraid of but it also helps to know it kind of normal if not optimal are you feeding her when she wakes up at night and you have to go in because she has settled if so you might have luck with reducing the night time wake ups by night weaning her if there nothing to wake up for she may very well just stop waking up there are ton of ways to go about night weaning her but one way you can do it is to drop one feed at time if she wakes up at approx 1a 3a and 5a for example start with the 1a feed when you drop that feed it means she ca eat until 3a it sucks because at first she may never really settle until that 3a feed but after few days she should stop waking up for that feed or she will be easier to settle if she does because she wo be looking for food once she consistently good about sleeping until 3a you can drop that feed too then for the 5a feed or whatever time that last wake up feed is you can decide if you also want to drop that or if you re ok with that one on the other hand you can also go cold turkey this is my preferred route but know it hard on some babies parents to do it this way in my opinion it usually works the fastest and results in the least amount of total crying would plan to combine this with cio the check in interval kind not the extinction kind one thing that lot of parents notice is that once they start this method even if they plan to do it over time and drop feeds slowly they do even have to because once they learn to get through dropping the first feed they do even wake up for the others my daughter went through sleep regression at this age it will pass havent read the comments etc but my baby was an absolute terror bad sleeper bad eater absolutely miserable mood most of the time loved to cry and desperately attatched to my hip thought nothing would ever change it then right on his first birthday he started walking and did complete 180 he started sleeping through the night and even started sleeping seperate from me started eating more and didnt want to be touching me nearly as much he also went down to one nap couple months later and its great he just runs until he cant anymore and knocks himself out know hated reading it when was looking for answers during the first year but think you just got to wait it out things will change eventually concur with this post very similar situation removed it is probably advice you ve already received but would see if it is 1st comfort thing too hot or cold diaper too tight little wet feet cold air blowing on her etc then would try fuller tummy before bed then would consider gas or acid reflux gas drops worked great for us but know it everyone likes them same could have written the op and right around 22 months my son stopped waking up at night no idea why we had great habits and routine it seemed like he just was ready cosleeping did help us it just made it hard for our son to sleep so he always slept in his own room when my lo was months he was good sleeper but we did have few nights each week that he would wake up starving despite me feeling like spent over half my day feeding him maybe growth spurt also thought maybe it was from teething and wanted some comforting from bottle we started doing second dinner give him bowl of oatmeal and fruit about an hour before bed and whatever snacks he wants after that some nights it is shocking how much he can eat but he is super active especially once daddy gets home from work think he just blows through calories and needs more some kids just do that unfortunately some things you can do to help sometimes are big feeding right before bed at months she should be eating solids bit so make sure she gets solid and good nurse before bed if they stay topped up as long as possible during the night they often wake less watching that she does nap too long during the day can help you can usually get feel for it waking her gently by leaving door open picking her up and cuddling her something like that you do want her sleep deprived or anything but you also do want her to get the majority of her sleep during the day what is she doing when she awake at night is she crying fussing and mucking around just hanging out there big sleep regression at months old it was the worst one for us when my lo was that age there were millions of posts about the month sleep regression but guess no one posts about it lately just ride it out is all you can do it will be rough weeks it will be over soon good luck have kids my first was an awful sleeper took an hour plus to go to bed every night woke up 3+ times night until she was almost my second slept like log went to sleep easy only woke up enough to nurse at night and probably would have sleep trained in hot second if we ever gotten serious about it my 3rd slept when she was tired meaning that she either crashed hard and slept solid or was up and down all night kids same parents same parenting but totally different sleepers the point is that it probably not you it her so you can fight it and drive yourself crazy trying to figure out what you re doing wrong or you can just take this as the stage she at right now that does mean you have to **like** it sleep is awesome and it would always be great to get more but if you accept it as something that going to happen and arrange your life so you can go to bed earlier or take nap lol know or buy stronger coffee it easier to survive until she does start sleeping more soundly we have the vtech hippo and let me tell you that girl should be on the payroll she works so hard turn it on when we do his bedtime bottle yes know it mistake to let him go to sleep on the bottle but it works and we all need sleep so he listens to it as he falls asleep and then she in standby mode and if he makes enough noise to trigger her in the night she turns back on and plays music for 15 30 45 minutes depending on the setting you select then he watches her lights on the ceiling and listens to the soothing music and usually that gets him back to sleep some nights hear her once twice times and thankful each time also not sure how this would work with an ebf baby since we were on the bottle gradually added less and less formula to his middle of the night bottle until it was just one scoop in 8oz water normally scoops he learned real quick that bottle wasn so yummy and not worth waking up for but do also agree with everyone else saying they all get their in their own time good luck and sweet dreams my 12 mo old has been sleeping through the night since like mo old my year old on the other hand lawwd she cries for one of us in the middle of the night about 18 months is when my kiddo started sleeping through the night even with all the good habits we instilled pretty sure it normal and will pass in time my son did this his whole life until three weeks ago he almost 14 months though honestly think he sort of just did it on his own around 6:30 he eats huge dinner of solids try to get him as full as possible so lots of veggies carbs and protein then bath story time and nurse him it about 7pm at this point but now that he older don let him fall asleep to nursing anymore lay him down awake when first started this few weeks ago he would cry for anywhere from mins when walked out of the room now just lay him down awake he smiles at me and lets me walk out of the room it crazy lol the first two weeks of this sleep training was rough he still woke up 5x night even though quit letting him sleep in my bed and made him stay in his crib all night go in every time he woke up nurse him put him back and walk out of the room even if he was still crying but now he only wakes up one time around am for quick nurse lay him back in his crib and walk out of the room and then he sleeps until when wake him up before work don mind the 4am wake up because it only lasts few minutes and personally think 7pm 6am with no milk or water is too long shoot wake up in the middle of the night for water still lol plus work full time so like all the extra cuddles this was partially cry it out thing partially readiness thing he just changed lot at 13 months so if you don feel comfortable letting her cry much just give it few months and try again she might surprise you and make the process easy my youngest had the worst insomnia as baby and toddler his dr told me it was because he was not stimulated enough and that it was the sign of high intelligence as soon as he started preschool he started sleeping like rock did have any advice for now and know school is so far away so sorry this sounds completely normal to me have two kids your child is waking up because it biologically normal for them to do so if you want more sleep you could try co sleeping to some degree that what saved us once researched and realized there was no fix without adversely impacting babe night weaning etc we had this issue finally we put sippy of water in her crib she wake up have sip of water and go back to sleep it not you have two year old who still gets up at least once night have month old who sleeps through the night like champ hang in there mine did sleep all now got until he was 11 months month sleep regression we started sleep training around that time it could be sleep regression it could be teething it could be just how she is my daughter didn sleep through the night until she was she would wake up to use the bathroom after she was potty trained times night always at the same time and it didn matter that cut her off from fluids before bedtime my son on the other hand has been great sleeper from day he wanted to sleep all night from birth but of course woke him up to feed him until they said could start letting him sleep all night does she use pacifier personally am big proponent of pacifiers they help babies to self soothe and they help to reduce sids as well my son months uses wubbanub pacifier with small stuffed animal attached to it and he will find it in his sleep and pop it in his mouth and cuddles it additionally you can talk to your pediatrician about giving night time dose of tylenol or motrin for teething or you can talk to your pediatrician about giving your daughter rice cereal in the evening control over our children sleep habits is an illusion there nothing you can do people who tell you otherwise are either trying to sell you something or make themselves feel good by comparison they can be so different that fair it is hard not to compare to the first born is it miss cosleeping we did that until months or so have supportive husband so luckily get to catch up on sleep if she sleeps in he gets up with our oldest swear the first baby can be bad sleeper and it is the end of the world have months old and she is working on her top teeth right now they are growing all at the same time she wakes up times at night feed her and she goes right back to sleep no crying what so ever sleep trained my older son lots of crying sleepless nights for all of us lots of stress and feeling guilty he started to sleep through the night only at do even want to go through that again if sleep training does work there is nothing we can do about it enjoy the time they are little give them lots of love and cuddles when they need it there is no reason to fight baby they just want their parents to be there for them even though my daughter does sleep through the night still get lots of sleep wake up rested and feel much better than used to with my first baby my son dropped his night wakings when started sending dad in to soothe or feed with bottle at months my husband gradually reduced how much he offered during the night until we went cold turkey recommend precious little sleep https www preciouslittlesleep com what you need to know about sleeping through the night part for some tips on weaning you can also hit up sleeptraining quick breastfeed maybe 10 mins and she is back asleep ve been working on shortening the time to try and wean bit we will see that been my go to blog love it yes suggest this resource to everyone it my favorite parenting book there facebook group too that has lots of suggestions if you re regular precious little sleep blog book reader you might find even more suggestions there is she like gulping and seriously eating in those moments or comfort nursing seems like it is both sometimes she actually eats enough for let down but not usually feel like it more comfort oky would try just snuggling to sleep then or pick up rock and put down you might have few rough nights but she will figure it out esp since she goes to sleep without nursing my baby eats full meal or at night so we persist although she slept from 630 last night with no wake ups she sleeps better when am home with her the day before she is not big eater at daycare and tends to wake up more those nights ve heard of this we were researching why suddenly my awesome little dude would wake multiple times night and was overall moody bastard turns out right before big developmental milestones walking they get frustrated because they want to be further ahead and just have quite reached it yet simplifying of course but this is thing
